intro: Diasperus chrysanthus, commonly known as the golden cupplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow composite flowers. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves and a flowering stem that rises above the foliage. Its flowers are typically arranged in a single head, with ray florets surrounding disc florets. Diasperus chrysanthus is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
